briefdescription.para: Number of bits per pixel used by the display.

simplesect.para: The number of bits per pixel.

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint16_t *sourceData, const Rect &source, const Rect &blitRect, uint8_t alpha, bool hasTransparentPixels)
memberdef.name: blitCopy

briefdescription.para: Blits (directly copies) a block of data to the framebuffer, performing alpha blending (and tranparency keying) as specified.

detaileddescription.para: Performs a software blend if HAL does not support BLIT_COPY_WITH_ALPHA and alpha != 255 (solid).

parameterdescription.para: The source array pointer (points to the beginning of the data). The sourceData must be stored in a format suitable for the selected display.
The position and dimensions of the source. The x and y of this rect should both be 0.
A rectangle describing what region of the sourceData is to be copied to the framebuffer.
The alpha value to use for blending ranging from 0=invisible to 255=solid=no blending.
If true, this data copy contains transparent pixels and require hardware support for that to be enabled.

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint8_t *sourceData, Bitmap::BitmapFormat sourceFormat, const Rect &source, const Rect &blitRect, uint8_t alpha, bool hasTransparentPixels)
memberdef.name: blitCopy

briefdescription.para: Blits (directly copies) a block of data to the framebuffer, performing alpha blending (and tranparency keying) as specified.

detaileddescription.para: Performs a software blend if HAL does not support BLIT_COPY_WITH_ALPHA and alpha < 255 (solid).
If the display does not support the specified sourceFormat, an assert will be raised.

parameterdescription.para: The source array pointer (points to the beginning of the data). The sourceData must be stored in a format suitable for the selected display.
The bitmap format used in the source data.
The position and dimensions of the source. The x and y of this rect should both be 0.
A rectangle describing what region of the sourceData is to be copied to the framebuffer.
The alpha value to use for blending ranging from 0=invisible to 255=solid=no blending.
If true, this data copy contains transparent pixels and require hardware support for that to be enabled.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Rect &visRegion, const Rect &absRegion, const BitmapId bitmapId)
memberdef.name: copyFrameBufferRegionToMemory

briefdescription.para: Copies part of the framebuffer to the data section of a bitmap.

detaileddescription.para: The bitmap must be a dynamic bitmap or animation storage (BITMAP_ANIMATION_STORAGE). The two regions given are the visible region and the absolute region on screen. This is used to copy only a part of the framebuffer. This might be the case if a SnapshotWidget is placed inside a Container where parts of the SnapshowWidget is outside the area defined by the Container. The visible region must be completely inside the absolute region.

parameterdescription.para: The visible region.
The absolute region.
Identifier for the bitmap.

simplesect.para: Null if it fails, else a pointer to the data in the given bitmap.
There is only one instance of animation storage. The content of the bitmap data /animation storage outside the given region is left untouched.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Bitmap &bitmap, int16_t x, int16_t y, const Rect &rect, uint8_t alpha=255, bool useOptimized=true)
memberdef.name: drawPartialBitmap

briefdescription.para: Draws all (or a part) of a bitmap.

detaileddescription.para: The coordinates of the corner of the bitmap is given in (x, y) and rect describes which part of the bitmap should be drawn. The bitmap can be drawn as it is or more or less transparent depending on the value of alpha. The value of alpha is independent of the transparency of the individual pixels of the given bitmap.

parameterdescription.para: The bitmap to draw.
The absolute x coordinate to place (0, 0) of the bitmap on the screen.
The absolute y coordinate to place (0, 0) of the bitmap on the screen.
A rectangle describing what region of the bitmap is to be drawn.
(Optional) Optional alpha value ranging from 0=invisible to 255=solid. Default is 255 (solid).
(Optional) if false, do not attempt to substitute (parts of) this bitmap with faster fillrects.

briefdescription.para: Enables the texture mappers for A4 image format.

detaileddescription.para: This allows drawing A4 images using Bilinear Interpolation and Nearest Neighbor algorithms.

briefdescription.para: Enables the texture mappers for A4 image format.

detaileddescription.para: This allows drawing A4 images using Bilinear Interpolation algorithm.

briefdescription.para: Enables the texture mappers for A4 image format.

detaileddescription.para: This allows drawing A4 images using Nearest Neighbor algorithm.

briefdescription.para: Enables the texture mappers for all image formats.

detaileddescription.para: This allows drawing any image using Bilinear Interpolation and Nearest Neighbor algorithms, but might use a lot of memory for the drawing algorithms.

briefdescription.para: Enables the texture mappers for ARGB2222 image format.

detaileddescription.para: This allows drawing ARGB2222 images using Bilinear Interpolation and Nearest Neighbor algorithms.

briefdescription.para: Enables the texture mappers for ARGB2222 image format.

detaileddescription.para: This allows drawing ARGB2222 images using Bilinear Interpolation algorithm.

briefdescription.para: Enables the texture mappers for ARGB2222 image format.

detaileddescription.para: This allows drawing ARGB2222 images using Nearest Neighbor algorithm.

briefdescription.para: Enables the texture mappers for ARGB8888 image format.

detaileddescription.para: This allows drawing ARGB8888 images using Bilinear Interpolation and Nearest Neighbor algorithms.

briefdescription.para: Enables the texture mappers for ARGB8888 image format.

detaileddescription.para: This allows drawing ARGB8888 images using Bilinear Interpolation algorithm.

briefdescription.para: Enables the texture mappers for ARGB8888 image format.

detaileddescription.para: This allows drawing ARGB8888 images using Nearest Neighbor algorithm.

briefdescription.para: Draws a filled rectangle in the framebuffer in the specified color and opacity.

detaileddescription.para: By default the rectangle will be drawn as a solid box. The rectangle can be drawn with transparancy by specifying alpha from 0=invisible to 255=solid.

parameterdescription.para: The rectangle to draw in absolute display coordinates.
The rectangle color.
(Optional) The rectangle opacity, from 0=invisible to 255=solid.

briefdescription.para: Framebuffer format used by the display.
Framebuffer stride in bytes.

detaileddescription.para: The distance (in bytes) from the start of one framebuffer row, to the next.

simplesect.para: The number of bytes in one framebuffer row.

briefdescription.para: Gets the blue color part of a color.

detaileddescription.para: As this function must work for all color depths, it can be somewhat slow if used in speed critical sections. Consider finding the color in another way, if possible.

parameterdescription.para: The 16 bit color value.

simplesect.para: The blue part of the color.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t red, uint8_t green, uint8_t blue) const
memberdef.name: getColorFrom24BitRGB

briefdescription.para: Generates a color representation to be used on the LCD, based on 24 bit RGB values.

detaileddescription.para: Depending on your chosen color bit depth, the color will be interpreted internally as either a 16 bit or 24 bit color value. This function can be safely used regardless of whether your application is configured for 16 or 24 bit colors.

parameterdescription.para: Value of the red part (0-255).
Value of the green part (0-255).
Value of the blue part (0-255).

simplesect.para: The color representation depending on LCD color format.

briefdescription.para: Gets the green color part of a color.

detaileddescription.para: As this function must work for all color depths, it can be somewhat slow if used in speed critical sections. Consider finding the color in another way, if possible.

parameterdescription.para: The 16 bit color value.

simplesect.para: The green part of the color.

briefdescription.para: Gets the red color part of a color.

detaileddescription.para: As this function must work for all color depths, it can be somewhat slow if used in speed critical sections. Consider finding the color in another way, if possible.

parameterdescription.para: The color value.

simplesect.para: The red part of the color.

briefdescription.para: Performs initialization.

detaileddescription.para: Can be called at any time to re-initialize the LCD object.

briefdescription.para: Gets blue from color.

parameterdescription.para: The color.

briefdescription.para: Gets color from RGB.

parameterdescription.para: The red.
The green.
The blue.

briefdescription.para: Framebuffer stride in bytes.

detaileddescription.para: The distance (in bytes) from the start of one framebuffer row, to the next.

simplesect.para: The number of bytes in one framebuffer row.

briefdescription.para: Gets green from color.

parameterdescription.para: The color.

briefdescription.para: Gets red from color.

parameterdescription.para: The color.

briefdescription.para: Private version of draw-glyph with explicit destination buffer pointer argument.

detaileddescription.para: For all parameters (except the buffer pointer) see the public function drawString().

parameterdescription.para: The destination (frame) buffer to draw to.
The canvas to draw the glyph inside.
Horizontal offset to start drawing the glyph.
Vertical offset to start drawing the glyph.
Horizontal offset in the glyph to start drawing from.
Vertical offset in the glyph to start drawing from.
The area to draw inside.
Specifications of the glyph to draw.
Data containing the actual glyph (dense format)
The glyph is saved using ST A4 format.
The color of the glyph.
Bit depth of the glyph.
The transparency of the glyph.

The render variant.

memberdef.name: blitCopyAlphaPerPixel

briefdescription.para: Blit a 2D source-array to the framebuffer performing alpha-blending per pixel as specified Performs always a software blend.

parameterdescription.para: The source-array pointer (points to the beginning of the data). The sourceData must be stored as 8-bits ARGB2222 values.
The location and dimensions of the source.
A rectangle describing what region is to be drawn.
The alpha value to use for blending applied to the whole image (255 = solid, no blending)

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint32_t *sourceData, const Rect &source, const Rect &blitRect, uint8_t alpha)
memberdef.name: blitCopyARGB8888

briefdescription.para: Blit a 2D source-array to the framebuffer performing alpha-blending per pixel as specified if ARGB8888 is not supported by the DMA a software blend is performed.

parameterdescription.para: The source-array pointer (points to the beginning of the data). The sourceData must be stored as 32- bits ARGB8888 values.
The location and dimensions of the source.
A rectangle describing what region is to be drawn.
The alpha value to use for blending applied to the whole image (255 = solid, no blending)

briefdescription.para: This class contains the various low-level drawing routines for drawing bitmaps, texts and rectangles on 16 bits per pixel displays.

simplesect.para: All coordinates are expected to be in absolute coordinates!
